tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

Police move in after Herefordshire river bulldozed and straightened https://t.co/zLdRlYgqQ0
Witness describes damage to mile-long stretch of Lugg as egregious act of ‚Äòecological vandalism‚Äô @SalmonTroutCons @NaturalEngland  @ForestryComm @EnvAgency https://t.co/hsQfSxvBTg

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

tweets.text: @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Sadly it's probably a case of closing the stable door after the horse has bolted

@Ministryofspeak @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Perhaps my expectations are lower, I think thats quite quick..to organise a response from multiple agency's..

@becclestown @KeasdenKate @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland Yes. And Police if there is reasonable evidence or suspicion that protected species have been affected (they uphold the W&C Act - custodial sentence possible). Planning permission for engineering operations too may have been needed too.

@stwater Let‚Äôs keep each other posted. 

And can you get someone in @stwater @EnvAgency @Ofwat @Ringway_Worcs @WorcsTravel @worcscc (or even Simon G @Worcester_Tory) to tell me how much water has been wasted awaiting a permit for an already closed road? https://t.co/Vw7DcI06Qq

@FHawksworth @ShropshireCraft @1Finches @geoffshumba @Jennife10651535 @CallMeMoNow @charbhardy @woolhatwoman @david__s @McminnSandeep @NethertonNews @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil This is devastating to me. The river Lugg is stunning and part of my childhood.üò•

@FHawksworth @1Finches @geoffshumba @RslewisSally @Jennife10651535 @CallMeMoNow @charbhardy @woolhatwoman @david__s @McminnSandeep @NethertonNews @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil I should hope they get to the bottom of it. tweets.text: @sarahhenshall @Buzz_dont_tweet @NaturalEngland @incendiarypig It's absolutely horrifying isn't it. I keep alternating between anger and sadness.  Shocking that this was allowed to happen. Let's hope @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency bring the full force of the law to bear now. üòûü§¨
@RobGMacfarlane @Jamie_Woodward_ @EnvAgency Why don‚Äôt they name the landowners?

It's a claim that Kingsland Parish Council are prepared to backup. In a statement issued yesterday they say "The parish council supports work to improve the Lugg that is undertaken at the direction and instigation of the Environment Agency".

https://t.co/E5q4cmEzCk
@iojikLeigh @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency It was a farmer, who interestingly claims he had the permission of the parish council and environment agency. All very worrying!

@DanielMacKenzi6 @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Think you better speak to the locals! They are all so relieved that this has been done due to years of flooding! The EA has done nothing about it! You need to look into this further before you criticise my response
